snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said he would support raising the state minimum wage — currently $8 per hour — and he might also support an even greater wage for high cost-of-living areas like New York City.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo reverses position on minimum wage in New York, saying he will support demand of Working Families Party that municipalities with higher costs of living be allowed to set higher minimum wage; endorses statewide increase to $10.10 an hour and minimum wage as much as 30 percent higher in places such as New York City, Westchester County and Nassau County.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said he would support raising the state minimum wage — currently $8 per hour — and he might also support an even greater wage for high cost-of-living areas like New York City.
